page.title: 01WELSHPOOL - AN INTRODUCTION.
page.content: Welshpool is a small market town of about 7,000 people situated on the River Severn near the English border about 18 miles south west of Shrewsbury.The old border between the two countries,Offa's Dyke, runs about 1\ miles to the east of the town. The town is in the middle of a farming community and is an important agricultural and market centre. The town's Welsh name is{"Y Trallwng"} which means a marshy place but in spite of its name it has few Welsh speaking inhabitants. The town became known as Welshpool in the 19th Century to distinguish it from Poole in Dorset. The{livestock market}is one of the largest in Europe. Other attractions include{Powys Castle,}one of the two remaining{cockpits}in Wales, a{light railway, museum}and a recently restored{canal.}
